basics.name: Madan Baduwal
basics.label: Machine Learning Engineer
basics.summary: Machine learning engineer with 4+ years of experience in AI and Software Engineering.

work.name: Matrice.ai
highlights: Designed and developed a no-code data-centric AI platform for building and deploying ML apps, reducing user deployment time by 40% and development costs by 80% using Pytorch, React, Django, and AWS technologies.

work.name: BP Eye Foundation
highlights: Optimized and automated semantic segmentation and detection (accuracy: 85%) for otitis media Otoscopy images of the tympanic membrane, driving $100k of revenue annually by increasing the doctor-patient ratio by 1.5x.
Deployed the app as a SaaS product, using technologies such as Pytorch, Django, Dell EMC servers, and CI/CD

work.name: Fusemachines
highlights: Led a 10-person team to develop an AI-enabled student progress tracking platform (fuseclassroom.com), doubling the teacher-student ratio to 1:30. Currently operational in ∼60 Nepalese colleges with 20k active students.

Orchestrated a phishing detection engine for over 10 clients under WMC Global, improving accuracy from 85% to 90% by selecting the optimal number of clusters using the silhouette score, detecting millions of URLs per day.
Automated workflow with MLOps tools: Docker, Kubernetes, GitHub, Jenkins, Apache Airflow, and Datadog.

Conducted over 20+ trainings, workshops, knowledge-sharing, and paper reading sessions on mathematics and machine learning. Empowered ML skills of ∼5k students by collaborating with schools, colleges, and universities.

Enriched AI affordable courses by researching, designing, reviewing, and refining content, including reading material, quizzes, assignments, and projects for Fusemachines AI Education Programs, specifically focusing on the ”Micro Degree in Artificial Intelligence, Machine Learning, Computer Vision, and Natural Language Processing.”

work.name: National Innovation Center
highlights: Led & collaborated with mechanical, electrical, and electronic hardware teams to deploy computer vision tasks in robots, resulting in the creation of initial prototypes for waiter and service robots within a span of 9 months.

Achieved 60% inference acceleration on computer vision tasks integrating into robots using quantization techniques and hardware-software accelerators like Google Coral TPU, NVIDIA J.Nano, Raspberry Pi., and Microsoft Azure.

Implemented and fine-tuned computer vision tasks, including object detection, segmentation, tracking, face recog-nition, and depth estimation, using PyTorch and the Intel depth camera D435i, covering the entire vision pipeline.
Improved pathfinding algorithms (A* and Dijkstra), leading to a 20% reduction in execution time and faster NAV.

work.name: Omnibluetech
highlights: Designed and developed Django REST APIs and AWS-based background workers capable of managing millions of daily requests, facilitating third-party entities in extracting data from unstructured documents in a scalable fashion.

Implemented web applications using front-end and back-end technologies: HTML5, CSS, Javascript, and Django for retail stores and consultancies, resulting in a 15% increase in revenue for the company in the first quarter.
Research on multimodal learning chatbots

publications.name: Signature Verification using Convolutional Neural Network and Autoencoder
publications.publisher: Prakash Ratna Prajapati, Samiksha Poudel,Madan Baduwal,S.,Burlakoti, S.,Pandey
publications.summary: Signature Verification using Convolutional Neural Network and Autoencoder

skills.name: Computer Science
highlights: Research on Multimodal learning

Python Packages : Numpy, Theano, Pandas, Matplotlib, Seaborn, Scikit-learn, XGBoost, Pytorch, Tensorflow, Hugging Face, Mlflow, Caffe, Opencv, NLTK, Scipy, Regex, BeautifulSoup, TVM, GLOW, XLA
Big Data and Databases : PostgreSQL, MySQL, MongoDB, Snowflake, Spark, Hadoop, Redshift, Databrick, Kafka,  Tableau, ETL
Frameworks: Django, Fastapi, Flask, React Native, Node.js, React, ANgular, Spring Framework
Robotics: Robot Operating System(ROS), Gazebo, Arduino, R.pi, C.TPU, J.Nano
Miscellaneous : Jupyter Notebook, Linux, Git, Github, Docker, Kubernetes, CI/CD,Jenkins

highlights: Assisting in the editing and proofreading of manuscripts for publication under the direction of Prof.Rebecca Babcock and Prof.Mohamed K Zobaa.
Successfully led a team of orientation volunteers to ensure smooth execution of university orientation programs, demonstrating strong leadership skills and ability to delegate tasks effectively.

projects.name: Quantum Computing
projects.summary: Quantum computing is the use of quantum-mechanical phenomena such as superposition and entanglement to perform computation. Computers that perform quantum computations are known as quantum computers.
highlights: Quantum Teleportation
Quantum Cryptography

awards.title: Nobel Prize in Physics
awards.summary: The Nobel Prizes are five separate prizes that, according to Alfred Nobel's will of 1895, are awarded to 'those who, during the preceding year, have conferred the greatest benefit to humankind.'
